The spring force is given by \( F_s = kx \)
The normal force \( F_N \) is the component of the spring force perpendicular to the surface of the lock groove
The frictional force \( F_f \) is given by \( F_f = \mu F_N \)
For the door to be in a self-locking state, the sum of the forces in the direction of the sliding door must be zero
The component of the spring force in the direction of the sliding door is \( F_{s\parallel} = F_s \sin \theta \)
The component of the frictional force in the direction of the sliding door is \( F_{f\parallel} = F_f \cos \theta \)
Setting the sum of the forces in the direction of the sliding door to zero gives \( F_{s\parallel} - F_{f\parallel} = 0 \)
Substituting the expressions for \( F_{s\parallel} \) and \( F_{f\parallel} \) and solving for \( F_N \) gives \( F_N = \frac{2kx}{1 - 2\sqrt{3}\mu - \mu^2} \)
